title: Italian Style Restaurant Flyer fonts
content:
I realize this is hand lettering, but I wanted to create something with a similar vibe.

Any idea where I could find a collection of typefaces similar to these? Particularly with rough-ish edges so it has a hand drawn look?

Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [fonts.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20091128134847/http:/typophile.com/files/fonts.gif) | 328.36 KB |
author: tomjonesrocks

comments.content:
Hand-drawn lettering is what my [Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20091128134847/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/ScriptIDGuide.html) is all about. Use Part 6 for sans lettering styles (maybe Part 5 has some too), and Part 7 for the connected script styles. Grungier, bouncier fonts are in Part 14.

- Mike Yanega
